pub_created_display: Ardashir I (224 to 240), 1/6 Δ, Group / Mint C ("Ctesiphon")
numismatic_provenance_s: Pegasi Numismatics, Ann Arbor, MI; 10/11/2000; IV (248)
issue_place_s: Group / Mint C ("Ctesiphon"), Asuristan, Sasanian Empire
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Ardashir I on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: covered crown cap surmounted by covered korymbos; plain diadem; pendent diadem ribbons; tunica; dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o. mzdysn bgy 'rthštr MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n MNW ctry MN yzd'n| mazdēsn bay Ardašir šāhān šāh Ērān kē čihr az yazdān| "the Mazda-worshiping, divine Ardashir, King of Kings of the Iranians, whose image / brilliance is from the gods"
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with vertical strokes; to the left and right mushroom-shaped bases supporting lion-paw structures; below left and right edge of altar table pendent diadem ribbonbase consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with vertical strokes; to the left and right mushroom-shaped bases supporting lion-paw structures; below left and right edge of altar table pendent diadem ribbon; dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 9 h r. o. (retrograde) NWRA [ZY]- 2 h r. o. (retrograde) 'rthštr| ādur ī Ardašīr| “the fire of Ardashir”; two dots below alter base (SNS1, var. 10)
